title: Album Page, "Black Forest Sketches, Gaggenau", September 18, 1887
medium: Brush and watercolor over graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, below drawing at left: Closed on this side / if one likes -  often / leads to a court and / Then there is another one to come out of - / Gaggenau / Sept 18th 1887; below drawing at right: Black Forest Sketches - / Bell cupola / Gaggenau / Sept 18th 1887; at top right corner: (inscribed in circle) 48 / 60.
description: Vertical sheet with two sketches of buildings.  At left is a half-timbered building with a shingled or tiled steeply pitched roof that has a very deep overhang.  The building is raised up on tall timber supports that create a framed archway beneath the first story, which has a white façade and two windows with green shutters.  The sketch at right is possibly the same building seen at lower right in 1943-51-127.  It is a long building also with a steeply pitched shingled or tiled roof that is canted at the end.  A clock face is visible in a triangular roof dormer.  Above this is a bell-shaped cupola surmounting a very thin structure.  The cupola has a tall finial with ball and weathervane ornament.
